statements.name: PROC FSLIST
statements.description: Enables you to browse external files that are not SAS data sets within a SAS session.

arguments.name: FILEREF
arguments.description: specifies the external file to browse. File-specification can be one of the following:

arguments.name: DDNAME
arguments.description: specifies the external file to browse. File-specification can be one of the following:

arguments.name: DD=
arguments.description: specifies the external file to browse. File-specification can be one of the following:

arguments.name: 'external-file'
arguments.description: is the complete operating environment file specification (called the fully qualified pathname under some operating environments) for the external file. You must enclose the name in quotation marks.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a fileref that has been previously assigned to the external file. You can use the FILENAME statement to associate a fileref with an actual filename. For more information, see .

arguments.name: UNIT=
arguments.description: defines the FORTRAN-style logical unit number of the external file to browse. This option is useful when the file to browse has a fileref of the form FTnnF001, where nn is the logical unit number that is specified in the UNIT= argument. For example, you can specify the following: proc fslist unit=20; instead of proc fslist fileref=ft20f001;

arguments.name: CAPS
arguments.description: controls how search strings for the FIND command are treated.

arguments.name: NOCAPS
arguments.description: controls how search strings for the FIND command are treated.

arguments.name: CC
arguments.description: indicates whether carriage-control characters are used to format the display.

arguments.name: FORTCC
arguments.description: indicates whether carriage-control characters are used to format the display.

arguments.name: NOCC
arguments.description: indicates whether carriage-control characters are used to format the display.

arguments.name: HSCROLL=
arguments.description: indicates the default horizontal scroll amount for the LEFT and RIGHT commands.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: sets the default scroll amount to n columns.

arguments.name: HALF
arguments.description: sets the default scroll amount to half the window width.

arguments.name: PAGE
arguments.description: sets the default scroll amount to the full window width.

arguments.name: NOBORDER
arguments.description: suppresses the sides and bottom of the FSLIST window's border.

arguments.name: NUM
arguments.description: controls the display of line sequence numbers.

arguments.name: NONUM
arguments.description: controls the display of line sequence numbers.

arguments.name: OVP
arguments.description: indicates whether the carriage-control code for overprinting is in effect.

arguments.name: NOOVP
arguments.description: indicates whether the carriage-control code for overprinting is in effect.
